summary: The concept of "scientific exchange" within EU cooperation policy emphasizes the advantageous interchange of knowledge and resources among researchers and scientists across various fields. This strategy aims to enhance productivity and stimulate innovation by addressing gaps in scientific collaboration. By empowering organizations to engage in live discussions and share the latest findings, the EU fosters a robust environment for technological advancement. The initiative recognizes the fundamental role of science in contributing to economic growth and societal wealth. Moreover, it encourages the formulation of policies that support the involvement of veterinary and natural sciences, ultimately strengthening the EUâ€™s position in global research.
